title: (x) Victorian era multi-face typography on menu - various {gang}
content:
Hi

Can anyone help me identify the typefaces used on this old style menu.

I think for example that the fresh fish line is the typeface Vinera  
but not sure where to start with the rest.

Can anyone help? thanks in advance

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1o.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/typophile.com/files/1o.jpg) | 168.29 KB |
author: chris.peters

comments.content:
Emigre’s Brothers and Council  
“Grill” HFJ’s Saracen — nope, make that Latin Wide  
“Homards Vivants” Sackers Roman

GRILLADES - [Brothers](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=83)  
FRUITS DE MER - [Council](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=86)

BRUNCH DU DIMANCHE - [Zebrawood Fill](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/F/ZEBQ/F_ZEBQ-10005090.html)

sunday brunch is zebrawood.  
grill is wide latin [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/latin-wide-ct/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/latin-wide-ct/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/latin-wide-ct/")

LIVE LOBSTER - [Engravers](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/engravers/)  
POISSONS FRAIS - [Vineta](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/vineta/vineta/)  
ALBERTA ANGUS BEEF - [Eurostile Demi](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/demi/)

FRESH FISH is an old font called Gold Rush. Vineta is similar but not a match. I haven’t found a digital version.

The small sans serif is [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021248/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.107947.0.1).
This is one of the nicer examples of Victorian era multi-face typography I’ve seen.
